Not really sure what to fink about it (hehe. You'll get the pun after you play the game) but seriously. Its not like bioshock in any shape or form. I mean sure there are the powers and the guns but it doesnt even have the whole bioshock feel. I mean it had a good story. But it just lacked a certain something you know.

7.5/10
Amazing trilogy of games. Loved all 3 of them and i'm ready for their announced 4th one in development

Amazing, emotional and for all types. You can't go wrong with bioshock - try it out as the whole collection is interesting, B. Infinite is modern and straight forward with an amazing twist that's barely hinted over since the begining.

GG!! Beautiful graphic Awesome and Deep story Attractive characters  
Masterpiece 10/10  Highly recommend

Bioshock Infinite has been, and continues to be, a game that keeps on giving to me. Each playthrough reveals something new, with just about every second still feeling enchanting regardless of how many times I stroll through it. It's almost a shame there are a few things holding it back from replacing Bioshock (2007) as my favorite game of all time.   

Here are the Nifty things I liked, and the Lame things I didn't.

[h1]The Nifty[/h1]
âœª I always have, and still very much do love the way this game tackles story-telling. In a sense, it brings back a lot of what made the original Bioshock's story so fantastic, then cranks it up to 11 in every area besides the pseudo first-person narrative. By that, I mean even though you're playing as a character with an established name and purpose, the original Bioshock's lack of making that identity clear made it feel like a more personal experience.

âœª In addition to that, this game does a fantastic job setting itself up for multiple runs. A lot of heavily story-driven games feel boring when I go back to play them again. However, with Bioshock and Bioshock Infinite, I'm always noticing something I missed in prior runs, learning new stuff and experiencing the game in a different way than I did before.

âœª The music is top notch. Almost every licensed song you hear either elaborates upon the situation you're currently experiencing, or provides a bit of foreshadowing that you might not notice until one of your next playthroughs. 

âœª  While on the subject of music, FrÃ©dÃ©ric Chopin's "Nocturne in E-Flat Major, Op. 9, No. 2" can be heard in several parts of the game. I'll always be dishing out bonus points for that one.

âœª Bioshock Infinite's combat may not be as extensive as the last two games, but it's still immensely satisfying and brings back good ideas from each; mostly Bioshock 2. Much like the aforementioned game, we're able to use [strike]plasmids[/strike] vigors at the same time as our firearms. We're also able to utilize two different versions of each, and combine vigors for more effective combat techniques.

âœª Though it's a DLC that must be purchased separately unless you bought the collection, Burial at Sea is a must play. Its setting, pace and gameplay mechanics are all fantastic, with a necessary expansion on not just Infinite's story, but also the original Bioshock's.  

[h1]The Lame[/h1]
âœ˜ Getting this game to run well, despite having a pretty solid rig that should easily handle it on the highest settings, was a tad irritating. In order to access ideal settings, I had to follow [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=203916658] this guide[/url], then spend almost an hour tweaking my mouse's sensitivity settings in not just the game, but the device's control center (iCUE, for the sake of referencing). 

Without doing all of this, even the slightest movements from my mouse caused a stuttering effect on my screen, the interface was far too small for me to see most of the time and my FOV, which I usually prefer being high as possible, only would have increased 15%. Sure, that last one is just me being picky, but the rest still stands. It was borderline unplayable without making a lot of adjustments.

âœ˜ You get plasmids in the form of vigors, run around a city that can only exist in fiction and are met with plot devices that scream "BIOSHOCK", but this, especially compared to the other entries in the franchise, is not a Bioshock game. There is so much missing from the original formula that it almost entirely feels like a canonical spin-off rather than the prequel/sequel this game strives to be, and for those wondering why people dislike Bioshock Infinite so much; that's it, most of the time. 

I could go into more elaborate detail explaining the dozens of things that made Bioshock 1 and 2 greater from a gameplay perspective. but instead, I'll simply say this; Bioshock Infinite is a game that is blatantly tailored toward telling an immersive story, which was designed to be enjoyable multiple times over, than being an immersive game.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
Even if it's not quite the Bioshock game many expected, including myself, Bioshock Infinite is still a near-perfect experience. All you have to do is stop comparing it to what you knew and accept it for what it is rather than what it was expected to be. It might not be my favorite game of all time like the original was, but it tells my absolute favorite story; especially when you toss Burial at Sea into the mix.

A worthy successor to the first Bioshock, Bioshock Infinite is one of my all time favourite games of all time. High-octane, rewarding gameplay; compelling characters, and an absolutely spell binding story. 10/10.

I absolutely recommend this for all players, but especially intelligent ones. The combat mechanics were fun, and had the same feel as the previous Bioshock games, the worldbuilding and architecture is brilliant and beautiful. the soundtrack is lots of fun, and the voice acting very well done. story was well rounded, and easy to empathise with characters made for a very satisfying playthrough. i will definitely be replaying this, i intend to go for every achievement.

El juego es increible no lo niego, pero llega un punto en que no sabes si estÃ¡s jugando a Bioshock o estÃ¡s viendo Evangelion de lo tan complicado que se vuelve entender la historia y la conexiÃ³n que tienen los otros juegos con este en especÃ­fico.

El unico juego que realmente me ha dejado boca abierta y sin aliento en algunas ocasiones en la narrativa, siendo posiblemente algo complejo de entender con los universos paralelos y sus efectos en otros, aunque en caso de que te quedes atorado en algunas partes de la historia, los DLC "Burial At Sea" te los complementa para tener una mejor interpretacion de las acciones.

En conclusion: uno de esos juegos (yo lo considero de los unicos juegos que existen actualmente) en los que debes de jugar mas de una o dos veces su historia para que logres conectar puntos y puedas saber el contexto que Ken Levine le trato de dar al juego. (Puede que no sea el perfecto pero si el mejor que he visto)

Muy buen juego de la familia de los Bioshock, si jugaron alguno y les gusto se los recomiendo totalmente. La historia es genial, cambio un poco la jugabilidad con respecto a los plasmidos pero no afecta en nada.
Easily one of the best story lines / plot in any game I have ever played. I think I have replayed this game 3 or 4 times.
